page.title: 07Farm machinery
page.content: In this area of scattered population, the majority of farmers had combine harvesters of their own.Only one hired or contracted out the harvest work.Most farmers had between 3 & 5 tractors which were used to undertake the many tasks on the farm,using such items of equipment as ploughs,balers,silage cutters etc. Some farmers had dairy herds and all of the associated milking equipment.This was housed in dairy parlours and included such items as the milking harnesses to attach to the cows udders,glass measuring flasks,etc.Also on each farm there was a refrigeration tank in which the milk was collected and stored until collection by road tanker each day. There has been a considerable increase in the amount of equipment used on farms since 1950 at the expense of the employment of a manual workforce
